questions.question: Does Azure allow you to overprovision resources with no additional cost?
Is Platform as a Service (PaaS) responsible for automatic scaling of application resources?
Can a public cloud deployment be hosted in a customer's own data center?
Is elasticity in cloud computing the same as scalability?
Are cost predictability and global reach both benefits of cloud adoption?
Explain the shared responsibility model in cloud computing and describe which aspects are managed by the customer versus the provider in different cloud service models.
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of security and management responsibilities in IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.
scoring_criteria: Correctly describes the shared responsibility model concept
Identifies provider responsibilities in IaaS (e.g., physical security, host OS)
Identifies customer responsibilities in IaaS (e.g., data, applications)
Explains the shift of responsibility in PaaS and SaaS
Gives at least one example for each service model
Emphasizes the importance of understanding these boundaries

questions.question: Compare private, public, and hybrid cloud deployment models, including their advantages and typical use cases.
questions.purpose: Test understanding of deployment models and when to use each.
scoring_criteria: Defines private, public, and hybrid cloud models accurately
Describes at least one advantage of each
Provides at least one use case for each model
Explains differences in control, security, and scalability
Mentions integration challenges or benefits for hybrid
Uses clear, concise language

questions.question: List and briefly explain three key benefits of cloud computing over traditional on-premises infrastructure.
questions.purpose: Evaluate the ability to articulate core business benefits.
scoring_criteria: Mentions cost savings or operational expenditure benefits
Mentions scalability or elasticity
Mentions global reach or high availability
Provides brief explanations for each benefit
Uses non-technical language suitable for business stakeholders
Avoids overlap or repetition

questions.question: Describe the main characteristics that differentiate SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS.
questions.purpose: Check knowledge of service models and their characteristics.
scoring_criteria: Defines SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS clearly
Explains who manages what in each model
Gives one example of each model
Describes at least one benefit per model
Highlights the level of user control in each
Uses accurate terminology

questions.question: Why is cloud elasticity important for businesses, and how does Azure provide this feature?
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of elasticity and its business value.
scoring_criteria: Defines elasticity correctly
Explains its importance for handling variable workloads
Describes at least one Azure feature/service that enables elasticity
Links elasticity to cost optimization
Mentions automation or auto-scaling
Provides a business-oriented example
